t: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy’s 2024 Letter to Shareholders
s: April 10, 2025 - We’ve had this long-held philosophy at Amazon about two-way and one-way door decisions. A two-way door decision is one where if you get the decision wrong, you can walk back through that door, revert to where you were, and there are few (if any) ramifications.

t: Jeff Bezos' first desk at Amazon was a door with four-by-fours for legs—here's why it still is today
s: January 23, 2018 - Bezos had to be frugal. So when Amazon's then-handful of employees needed desks, the entrepreneur found a cheap solution — he hacked them together himself with a door as the desktop and four-by-fours for legs.
